name: Hotel Splendide Royal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and I would recommend a lake view room on an upper floor - we were on the 6th storey. We were lucky to get the room upgrade as a result of calling in advance to explain the purpose of the stay but I must say the staff really made the whole stay a pleasure. They were always courteous, helpful, smiling and efficient. We have stayed in fancier 5 star hotels in terms of room luxury and facilities but we definitely enjoyed the "beautiful life" in the Italian part of Switzerland - and Lake Como is only 30 minutes away on the train, which we would recommend too!
reviews.title: The best team of hotel staff I have come across in Europe

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Splendide Royal in August as part of a Tauck "Italian Lakes" tour. This place is impeccable-expensive, but worth it. The service in particular is the best we've ever experienced in many hotel stays. I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Lovely, upscale hotel with impeccable service and wonderful view.

reviews.text: Great hotel but just a bit too much money for what you get but its in a great location, just a short 15 minutes walk to the middle of town.
reviews.title: nice but a bit over rated

reviews.text: We have just returned from a two-week Tauck tour of Italy and Lugano, Switzerland and the Hotel Splendide was just that. Every single employee we encountered was so kind and gracious. The view from the balcony is incredible - we ended up ordering room service for two nights and sitting outside to enjoy heaven on earth. I have never seen such an outstanding breakfast buffet and the waiters anticipate your every need. The bathrooms are large and luxurious. We received fresh fruit, complimentary water, bottle of wine and box of Swiss chocolates. And you can walk out the front door and down the tree-lined promenade to Lugano. This is one place I hope I get to return to in my lifetime.
reviews.title: Truly Splendid!

reviews.text: The service was excellent at this hotel. I had booked 2 rooms, both of which were non-lake view room. My parents decided they wanted to change to a lake view room and the Front desk did it immediately. They asked if I wanted to change my single room as well and they showed me 2 rooms, so I can pick whichever one I preferred. Service was very attentive overall from train station pick up to breakfast service.
reviews.title: Perfect service, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice hotel in the alps.we stayed in july for 4 days.i prefer milan,just an hour south of lugano but okay.nice place to relax. swiss hotelery noy at its best bust satisfactory.600us a day.too expensive.small rooms.kind of outdated. breakfast extra.nice view.friendly but sterile staff.smiling forbidden apparently. good food but very expensive. you should try polenta with pigeon.(70us) really good. icecream even better ! take a champagne to the room and enjoy it in company ! gorhgeous views.will be back. (i liked villa sassa better,cheaper and more elegant inside)
reviews.title: nice place in lugano.one of the best

reviews.text: If you like Lugano, this hotel is quite nice. We stayed in junior suite 302. Enormous two room, two bathroom suite with four balconies. Overlooking the lake. Good value for the price. Wine, fruit, cookies, and chocolate everyday. Fresh water bottles and turn down service were very nice. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on that. We were not crazy about Lugano. We did enjoy the boat though to the various small towns, spent a lot of time doing that, going up the funiculars and enjoyed our favorite Grotto Teresa. Other than that we are grateful for our wonderful accommodations because the rest of Lugano is way too much like where we are from.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in an OK City.

reviews.text: We celebrated our 11th wedding anniversary at the Splendide Royal in Lugano and it was unforgettable and so impressive. Not only the reception on our arrival was outstanding but also the free upgrading to the best rooms came as surprize to us. But that was just the beginning of a splendide stay at this beautiful 5 Star Hotel. Cherry on top was an anniversary chocolate cake accompanied by a bottle of champagne with a personal note from the General Manager, Mr Giuseppe Rossi. A great compliment goes to him and the whole staff who cares for all the personal wishes you may have. An exquisite restaurant, personal attention and a top location with breath taking lake view are just a few attributes of that Hotel. Highly recommended for an unforgettable stay in Lugano. Thanks to all the Splendide staff...
reviews.title: Just outstanding... Best Hotel in Lugano

reviews.text: good location, good rooms, victorian decor, luxurious bathroom. lovely breakfst. great service. very good concierge helped plan our 3 days. would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: the best in lugano

reviews.text: We arrived at he hotel the 9th of August and the welcome service was excellent and very warm.Our rooms were excellent .The breakfast at the front verandah was very good and believe me we wanted to stay there for hours .The room rates I found them reasonable for the quality and the service of this hotel.Do not forget to have a risotto in the restaurant.The only thing I did not enjoy was my morning cappuccino, but the regular coffee was very good.Anyway for three nights we spent there we were very satisfied,and I suggest this hotel to stay in Lugano..
reviews.title: DO NOT THINK ANOTHER HOTEL

reviews.text: This hotel was unique. The coverted convent had great rooms - very luxurious. The restaurant was one of the best meals we had on our 2-week tour of Italy - definitely the best in Rome. The location was a bit to be desired. It was probably a 10 or so minute walk to the Spanish steps (not 2 blocks). I was 29 and my wife 25 (and both very active) when we visited. The public transit in Rome left something to be desire, so the location of this hotel wasn't particularly helpful - the nearest Metro stop is at the Spanish Steps. I would stay here again if I was prepared to be near the Pantheon at night.
reviews.title: Great hotel, not great location
Great stay
reviews.text: My wife and I recently returned from Italy. Our last stay was at the Splendide Royal. It was a wonderful experience. We were originally booked at the De Russie but after reading some reviews we changed to the Splendide Royal. A very good move. From check in to check out the staff was always attentive and friendly. As we were to check out very early the staff had breakfast boxed and ready for us upon our early departure. Our room was a top floor room with a large balcony and a wonderful view of the city. The decor of the room was very tasteful. The restaurant on the top floor was the finest dining experience we had in Rome, a must. The hotels location is two blocks from the top of the Spanish steps.

reviews.title: Really Special Hotel
reviews.text: We recently were in Rome and made reservations at the Hotel Splendide Royal. We were provided with a lovely room with balcony with a wonderful view of Rome and the Vatican. The desk staff and concierge were helpful and courteous beyond expectation. My wife recently broke a rib and required a really soft mattress which was immediately provided. Upon leaving Rome and the hotel for approximately two weeks, we requested the hotel to hold some of our luggage until our return to Rome. This was done, once again with graciousness and efficiency. All the E:mail tour reservations discussed with the concierge prior to our arrival were provided as represented. The Restaurant in the hotel was exceptional and is deserving of a 5 Star Rating as is the hotel itself. We travel extensively and found this small hotel to be centrally located and without doubt one of the best in its price category.

reviews.title: Excellent Service
reviews.text: From the moment we walked in to the the moment we left back home the staff provided excellent service. The room was splendid and added to our romantic getaway. The dinning overlooking the Vatican City was something to remember. Will come back to enjoy the rest of Rome and Splendinde Royal will be part of it.

reviews.title: How much we aooreciated this hotel
reviews.text: We spent 9 days at the Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome from 9th to 18th June 2005. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The service at the hotel was first class, the attention to geusts' needs perfect, the ambience quite exceptional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the hotel until we departed the service in every area of this hotel was excellent. Our room overlooked the lake, it was a very good size and the housekeeping staff kept it spotless. There was always an above average supply of toiletries and at all times the laundry was clean and abundant. The breakfast was fresh and full of variety and the service was first class. We were on half board terms and all evening meals showed a very high standard of cuisine and once again the service was exemplary. Both the breakfast and evening dinner Maitre d' Hotels were excellent in carrying out their responsiblilites. The front of house staff were extremely helpful and always had time to deal with any enquiry.
reviews.title: What a fantastic hotel

reviews.text: We would highly recommend this hotel, at all times the service was first class service, and the staff were always friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Worst 5* ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even the 10 minute walk into Lugano is adjacent to a beautiful tree lined lake.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking forward to the pampering you normally get at a 5* hotel but unfortunately, didn't. We asked to book a table at the restaurant upon arrival, which they did, but when we went to have a look at the dining room (1 minute after we were told we did have a table), the maitre stated they were fully booked?! After a brief exchange during which we pointed out our disappointment, we decided to call room service only to get the worst Nicoise salad and Club Sandwich ever (boring, poor quality). The hotel manager heard about the problem with the restaurant and sent a champagne bottle and a jar of OJ, nice touch. This didn't distract us though from the long lived walls (black dirty corners) and very used furniture. The room was really tired.
reviews.title: Wonderful, great style experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a pleasant surprise the morning after though: we found the level of lavishness we were expecting from a 5* and a team of efficient and polite waiters.
reviews.title: Opulent and Lavish
opulant 5 star in good location.
reviews.text: We were a little perplexed when we found that on arrival at the Savoy we had been double booked and transferred to the Hotel Splendide Royal. Knowing nothing about the hotel we were pleasantly surprised on arrival to find 5 star attention from the moment we entered the lobby. The decor in the reception areas was grandiose and remained so throughout the hotel. We had booked a double and a twin which were honoured and both rooms were spacious and opulent. Reception staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and breakfast couldn't be faulted with a good range of fresh fruit, cereals and cooked fare. all consumed with a breathtaking view of the city. The hotel is in an excellant location being within 5 minutes walk of the Spanish steps and local restaurants offering good quality and value cuisine. This hotel boasts a small gym but no other amenities such as sauna, spa or jacuzzi which would be the only negative comment on this five star hotel.

reviews.title: It was a fantastic experience!
reviews.text: I recently stay in rome for easter and discover a fantastic hotel: the Splendide Royal! We booked the hotel through internet however we never heard about this new property and we were surprise about the level of the service and especially by the quality of its rooms. Our room was at 6th floor facing Villa Borghese and have an extraordinary terrace with view of all the city, the bathroom with daylight was very large with plenty of attention and amenities. We also tried the rooftop restaurant Mirabelle and this was also a special experience: quite expensive but great food, fantastic atmosphere, top level service and a unique view. I certainly recommended this hotel.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This Hotel is ideally situated for all tourist attractions. It is located on a hill with excellent views of the city from the Restaurant/Bar and Breakfast Room. The Breakfast Room is a terrace style which is coverered during the Winter. Even though the Breakfast Room was heated, at breakfast time we found this room to be a little cold during our Winter stay. This Hotel is situated in a quite area but still within walking distance of attractions. This Hotel is of superior decor, our room was very warm and comfortable but we found it to be a little on the small side for a five star rating. Our lasting impression was that of the staff, they were outstanding. From the polite staff who cleaned our rooms, the smiling and friendly staff who served during meal times to the happy reception staff, they were all extremely professional, helful and polite and made our stay very pleasant indeed. We would recommend this Hotel for it's location, comfort and excellent staff.

reviews.title: Brief stay in Rome
reviews.text: We only had a two day stay in Rome at the end of our Florence vacation. Our room was large, beautiful and clean. The bathroom was large and modern. We never met the concierge Ivan that everyone talks about but I guess the staff was friendly enough. Although our room in Florence was not as large and the hotel was only a four star hotel we enjoyed it more. The staff in Florence was very friendly , the internet use was free which didn't seem to be the case at the Splendide, they had coffee,teas, cappucinos ,hot chocolate in the rooms with a coffee maker which the Splendide did not have. As far as location is concerned, it is in a very nice area but plan to do alot of walking as Rome is a walking city and none of the sights that you would probably want to see are right next to each other. I'm not sure I would spend the money again without looking into other hotels in Rome. For all of the money we payed I don't think they offered enough of the little touches that make you feel welcome. As an aside, we enjoyed Florence much more than Rome.

reviews.title: do you really know this hotel
reviews.text: we stayed here before christmas 04. it was good enough, the staff were wonderfull, we had great tours which they recommended with a guide from angeltoursrome he was great, went the extra.

reviews.title: Splendide okay but not really a 5 Star
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Spendide over the Memorial Day weekend - 3 nights. Room was lovely and spacious by Rome standards. Bath was very nice. Huge beautiful balcony with jasmine blooming on it. Separate bedroom from sitting area. Plenty of storage in the room. If you are expecting this to be a true 5 star hotel though - well - the beds are sure not the Four Seasons - they are small (the Europe std though) and hard and have pressed - maybe starched linen sheets. So if you are looking for a 5 star Four Seasons experience - change your expectation. It's nice. It's lovely - very Italian ornate decor. Service is okay but also not 5 Star. Doorman - handsome guy but despite some generous tips had a total attitude about doing anything - even hailing a cab for you. Called to front desk at 7 AM for an iron and was told - no one available for an iron until 7:30. Went to front desk at 8 AM to get Iron myself and was told no one still available to unlock cabinent. Also - if you like a casual bar to pop into at the end of the day - none is available. Only bar is in very stuffed shirt and extremely elegant restaurant at top of hotel. Tried the bar up there but it's tiny and very expensive just for an end of the day drink. So my bottom line - if you want a nice, clean place to stay with some luxuries - the Hotel Splendide is good. If you want a true 5 star experience in Rome - this isn't your hotel.

Our third time in Rome was the charm when we found this perfectly situated, luxurious, romantic hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Our room and bathroom were huge, squeaky clean, and there was no outside noise. The view from our large balcony was divine -- a view of St. Peter's Basilica -- as well as the beautiful Villa Borghese Park. Many of the famous sites in Rome (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc.) were within easy walking distance from the hotel, a very important consideration for us when we search for a hotel in any city. The staff were so solicitous that we truly felt royal! We would definitely stay here again...and again!
reviews.title: Aptly named hotel -- splendide indeed!
Superb Service
reviews.text: My family and I stayed in the Hotel Splendide Royal for a weekend in April, we have stayed in various 4 and 5 star Hotels in Europe and have always been generally pleased with the service we have received, our stay at the HSR has changed our views on what excellent service really is.

reviews.title: best hotel stay ever
reviews.text: From the time we arrived to the time our break had come to an end the staff at the Hotel Splendide Royal made us feel like Royalty and there was nothing they wouldn't do for us, and they never made us feel awkward or feel as if we were putting them out, even at 1am when we returned from the Vatican (which is a short taxi drive from the Hotel) they greeted us with a smile and asked if there was anything they could do for us.

reviews.title: A joy for the mind and senses
reviews.text: The suite we stayed in was very clean and comfortable the entire Hotel was always very clean and is very well presented.

The name says it all, an imposing grand hotel in the belle époque style, on the lake front a 15 minute stroll from the centre of Lugano, exuding tradition and what passed for luxury in a bygone era. High ceilings, murano chandeliers, opulent decor, heavy drapes and gilt trimmings make this a classic grand luxe establsihment but just dont expect it to extent to the spa or tiny gym. Our room with a spacious balcony overlooking the lake was very warm and comfortable, with large modern bathroom (bath/toilet/shower in separate room from double handbasins/vanity) and dressing room.
reviews.title: The name says it all

reviews.text: Breakfast is served in a spacious dining room, with starched white tableclothes, attentive waiters and an outstanding selection of foods, juices,etc. The Verrandah restaurant is indulgent but ideally suited to a special occasion, serving quite possibly some of the best food in southern Switzerland.
reviews.title: Traditonal European hotel service at its best

reviews.text: Lack of wifi, shortage of outlets to plug in all the gear which needs recharging, an overly complex TV system which defeated all attempts to plug in an iPad/pod/phone and lack of coffee machine were our only gripes and more than compensated for by the basket of fruit, chocolates and complimentary bottle of sparkling wine which greeted us on arrival.
reviews.title: Superb service but some rooms need refreshing.

reviews.text: Beautifully positioned at the lake of Lugano, benefiting from sunshine the whole day (even in January), and run in the best hotel tradition Europe used to be famous for. Interiors are between traditional and chintzy, not trendy. Rooms and lay-out are spacious and generous. The breakfast buffet was not the oh-so-awful chain of hotels standard, but truly regional, international and high quality all at the same time. The staff in the breakfast area would be a credit to any 5* hotel in London or New York. Multi lingual and courteous - helping an elderly lady into her coat before she knew she would have a problem ! Only fault - hotel is overheated !!
reviews.title: Great location with beautiful walks along the lake

reviews.text: The personnel in the bar and restaurant are fantastic.... However the rooms are tatty and need refurbishment especially at the rates charged per night!!!! But the view is utterly wonderful and they serve THE BEST CLUB SANDWICH I have ever ever had!!!
reviews.title: a Splendide Rotary Lunch
LOVELY AND COZY
reviews.text: First time in ROMA, and what an experience. We arrived tired from a long 14 hour flight. Hotel Splendide Royal placed our needs as priority, and got us into our lovely room within a few minutes. The staff was friendly, attentive, and professional. The room was very nice, and quite roomy. The hotel is located in a very nice, clean, and safe neighborhood. From our hotel, we walked every day in every direction, day or night to a fun, or historical sight. Great restaurants, snack places, shopping, and people watching very close by. Remember! Before you take a trip, always read and study your destination, and all places you want to see. It was so much easier and fun.

reviews.title: Hotel is fine, restaurant is A1
reviews.text: Nice hotel, very friendly staff (a bit too much sometimes), good location. However, breakfeast is dissappointing for a 5* (especially the coffee), pay TV doesn't function properly, no radio to be found, and shower pressure is weak. Nothing terrific about the view over the Borghese villa. One of the windows has no curtain and the morning light can therefore be a nuissance.
Best part is the restaurant, with a truly A1 staff and chef.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Superb, Splendide Royal!
reviews.text: Otherwise, hotel alone is just average for the price paid.

reviews.title: A Must for Your Shortlist
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this beautiful hotel last August. It was our first time in Rome and I very much doubt we could have found anywhere else more perfect! Our room was gorgeous and the attention to detail was thoughtful. The staff were very discreet but friendly. One of the most romantic hotels we've ever stayed in. Highlight was sipping champagne on the rooftop balcony whilst gazing out over Rome - idyllic! Would love to return.

description: Housed inside an iconic Belle Epoque palace, the Splendide Royal is a refined hotel with a familiar atmosphere where 19th Century's grace blends with international contemporary flair. A state-of-the-art personilized service is provided by well trained and skilled staff, who quietly ensures the guests a pampering of local experience, through courtesy, dedication and attention to detail. Its tradition of hospitality, attentions and fine dining is valued by royal families, celebrities and famous artists since its opening in 1887.
